graph_description: This graph contains 418 nodes and 897 relationships. The graph density is 0.0103, indicating a sparsely connected network. The graph is fully connected with a fragmentation index of 0.0000. The most frequent entity types are 142 ""s, 94 "Location"s, 52 "Person"s, 48 "Artifact"s, 30 "Concept"s, 13 "Object"s, 6 "Flora"s, 5 "Animal"s, 5 "Group"s, 4 "Event"s, 4 "Organization"s, 3 "Anatomical Location"s, 3 "Other"s, 3 "Structure"s, and 1 "Landmark". The most frequent relationship types are 21 "attacks" relationships, 17 "wears" relationships, 11 "carries" relationships, 11 "observes" relationships, 10 "located in" relationships, 9 "approaches" relationships, 8 "features" relationships, 8 "interacts with" relationships, 7 "addresses" relationships, 7 "located on" relationships, 7 "possesses" relationships, 6 "associated with" relationships, 6 "contains" relationships, 6 "fights" relationships, and 6 "from" relationships.
retrieved_context:
Iteration 1 results:
G describes a graph among nodes Gurn. In this graph: The connections of Node Gurn have not been explored yet.

Iteration 2 results:
G describes a graph among nodes Grath, Gurn, Misty Ones, Noork, Sarna, Short powerful bow, Vasads, Von Mark, Zuran, bracelet of golden discs linked together with human hair, golden-skinned girl, jungle, jungle giant. In this graph: Node Grath is connected to to Gurn via labels_as/is_exile_from (relation description: The city rulers of Grath call Gurn a traitor.; Gurn is an exile from the walled city of Grath., textual evidence: The city rulers call him a traitor.; That is Gurn," admitted Noork shortly. "He is also an exile from the walled city of Grath.). Node Gurn is connected to to Grath via labels_as/is_exile_from (relation description: The city rulers of Grath call Gurn a traitor.; Gurn is an exile from the walled city of Grath., textual evidence: The city rulers call him a traitor.; That is Gurn," admitted Noork shortly. "He is also an exile from the walled city of Grath.), to Misty Ones via hunts/traps (relation description: Gurn states that they were trapping the Misty Ones., textual evidence: We were trapping the Misty Ones as they came across the lake), to Noork via is friend of/sends message to/wants_to_save/recognizes/addresses/wants to live with/reveals_self_to/intends_to_rescue (relation description: Noork states that Gurn is his friend.; Noork sends a message to Gurn via Ud, stating that demons no longer need to be feared and that the Misty Ones can be trapped and skinned.; Noork is trying to save Gurn.; Noork recognized Gurn.; Noork speaks to Gurn.; Noork wishes to live in peace with Gurn.; Gurn revealed himself to Noork after dropping his misty covering.; Gurn tells Noork that they would have come to his rescue.; Gurn speaks to Noork., textual evidence: For many days have I dwelt among the wild Vasads of the jungle with their golden-skinned chief, Gurn, for my friend.; Go to Gurn. Tell him to fear the demons no longer. Tell him the Misty Ones can be trapped and skinned.; Go to save Gurn's ...; "Gurn!" cried Noork.; Noork told him.; Now I can live in peace with you, Gurn; As he rose to his feet the robed figure let its misty covering drop aside. A handsome golden-skinned warrior stood revealed.; Soon we would have come to your rescue, Noork, my friend.; laughed Gurn. ... Noork, my friend.), to Sarna via is_aware_of_reason_for_exile_of/is_woman_of (relation description: Sarna knows why Gurn was exiled.; Sarna is referred to as Gurn's woman., textual evidence: Perhaps you know it as well?" "Indeed I do," cried Sarna.; Father's woman woman called Sarna.), to Short powerful bow via gifted (relation description: Gurn gave the short powerful bow to Noork., textual evidence: the short powerful bow that Gurn had given him), to Vasads via led by/are_loyal_to/leads/learned tongue of/is chief of (relation description: Gurn is the leader of the Vasads.; The Vasads are loyal to Gurn.; Gurn leads the Vasads.; Gurn learned the tongue of the Vasads.; Gurn is identified as the chief of the wild Vasads., textual evidence: the tongue of their gold-skinned leader, Gurn, the renegade; as the invisible mantles of Gurn's loyal Vasads opened; Since he had learned the tongue of the hairy Vasads of forest; For many days have I dwelt among the wild Vasads of the jungle with their golden-skinned chief, Gurn, for my friend.), to Von Mark via observes_state (relation description: Gurn looks at Von Mark who is dying., textual evidence: he looked at the dying Von Mark), to Zuran via advocates_against_enslavement_of (relation description: Gurn believes the captured Zurans should no longer be made slaves., textual evidence: My brother said that we should no longer make slaves of the captured Zurans from the other valleys.), to bracelet of golden discs linked together with human hair via wears (relation description: A question is posed about Gurn wearing a specific bracelet., textual evidence: Has he a bracelet of golden discs linked together with human hair?), to golden-skinned girl via observes/concentrates on (relation description: Gurn is observing the golden skinned girl.; Gurn's brow wrinkles with concentration upon seeing the girl., textual evidence: watched the trail forty feet below. For down there moved alertly a golden skinned girl; Sight of the girl's flowing brown hair and the graceful feminine contours of her smooth-limbed body beneath its skin-halter and the insignificant breech-clout, made his brow wrinkle with concentration.), to jungle via inhabits/learned tongue of (relation description: Gurn has lived in this jungle world.; Gurn learned the tongue of the Vasads of the forest., textual evidence: Not forever had he lived in this jungle world of valleys and ragged cliffs.; Since he had learned the tongue of the hairy Vasads of forest), to jungle giant via located in/observes from (relation description: Gurn is located in the crotch of a jungle giant.; Gurn observes the trail from the crotch of a jungle giant., textual evidence: crotch of a jungle giant; crotch of a jungle giant and watched the trail forty feet below.). Node Misty Ones is connected to to Gurn via hunts/traps (relation description: Gurn states that they were trapping the Misty Ones., textual evidence: We were trapping the Misty Ones as they came across the lake). Node Noork is connected to to Gurn via is friend of/sends message to/wants_to_save/recognizes/addresses/wants to live with/reveals_self_to/intends_to_rescue (relation description: Noork states that Gurn is his friend.; Noork sends a message to Gurn via Ud, stating that demons no longer need to be feared and that the Misty Ones can be trapped and skinned.; Noork is trying to save Gurn.; Noork recognized Gurn.; Noork speaks to Gurn.; Noork wishes to live in peace with Gurn.; Gurn revealed himself to Noork after dropping his misty covering.; Gurn tells Noork that they would have come to his rescue.; Gurn speaks to Noork., textual evidence: For many days have I dwelt among the wild Vasads of the jungle with their golden-skinned chief, Gurn, for my friend.; Go to Gurn.
